entry.title: pine: No screenshot on a different display orientation
entry.content:
Do not show the screenshot in the pine dialog if the image and the

display will show it has different orientations. One is landscape

while another is portrait, vice versa.



We are not going to set `image` of the `PineContentsData` in this case.

It is fine to keep the image in the disk, as the pine dialog will only

be shown on startup and the pine image in disk will be either deleted

or overridden on the next shutdown.



Test: Added PineTest.* + manually

Bug: b/322208753

entry.title: [A11y] For performance, skip text deletion and insertion events on ignored nodes
entry.content:
Skipping these events on nodes that are either remaining ignored,

were ignored, or are about to be ignored is a significant performance

win for the browser, and likely in ATs as well.



Ignored nodes are not exposed to ATs, and therefore firing change

events on them creates extra work without any benefit.



We were always paying this cost on some nodes, but it became worse

recently after landing stable ids CL:5328829. Previously when nodes

changed from ignored to ignored, the id often

also changed, which caused the AXNode to be a new node, and there was

no old vs new data to compare, preventing this code from running in

the first place.



About 1/3 of the tests had a 5-15% improvement in OnAccessibilityEvents, and the others didn't change significantly.



Bug: b/327473167

Change-Id: If88862e7623548467bd8bcbb1f728133701af7f9

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5341410

Reviewed-by: David Tseng

Commit-Queue: Aaron Leventhal

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1269672}

entry.title: Return currentcolor as a computed value on computedStyleMap
entry.content:
It's implied in css-color-3 and explicit in css-color-4 that the

currentcolor keyword computes to itself. Prior to this change,

entry.title: [iOS] Don't initiate non modal promos when promos cannot be displayed.
entry.content:
It is possible that after logging omnibox copy-paste event but before

the page is fully loaded users background the app. In this code path

there are no checks to make sure that non-modal promo can be displayed.

However on background it will record some histograms. In case when user

maxed out it's impression if we try to record histograms it will result

in a crash.



In this CL, make sure that logging non-modal promo triggering event

nothing will be initiated if promo cannot be displayed.



Bug: b/326565601

Change-Id: I90178635c82d05915d3d0939b1ae39a1ac62a13f

entry.title: iOS: Don't use vector<const T> for GetScripts() API
entry.content:
vector isn't standards-compliant and will be a compile

error eventually. See the bug for why it doesn't mean much too,

e.g. comment 16.



(vector is allowed and meaningful, since it applies the

`const` to the pointee, not the pointer.)



While here, also remove a `const` from a return type. Maybe

the `&` was missing and this meant to return a const ref, but

as it was, the `const` there had no effect. (A subclass does

return a temporary in an override, so changing to const ref

isn't easily possible.)



No behavior change.



Bug: 323708866

entry.title: [E2E] Use InsetObserver to manage inset and safe area observation
entry.content:
E2EControllerImpl#pushInsetsToBlink can cause conflict with the other callsite to WebContents#setSafeArea in InsetObserver. This change metigate that by delegating the call to InsetObserver#onSafeAreaChanged.



This change also make OnApplyWindowInsetsListener listening to the InsetObserver, instead of just being an listener to the root view. This should be a no-op from the end behavior, while making InsetObserver the only OnApplyWindowInsetsListener that coordinates different inset signals.



New behavior guarded behind killswitch DrawEdgeToEdgeInsetsManagement.



Bug: 325466918

Change-Id: Icfc1500b1f52f2ff6d423b4da2bbac5e962200c1

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5347337

Reviewed-by: Theresa Sullivan

Reviewed-by: Lijin Shen

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1269652}

entry.title: Revert "[Sampling Profiler] Send NavigationStart and DocumentToken to browser process"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 72267b90ef53ec1d603569786796ebd2be8ff2eb.



Reason for revert:

Remove unused code for abandoned global LCP tagging.



Original change's description:

> [Sampling Profiler] Send NavigationStart and DocumentToken to browser process

>

> This CL is part of a larger effort to tag stack samples between

> navigation start and LCP.

>

> This CL sends NavigationStart and DocumentToken from renderer to browser

> via `profile_metadata` field on `call_stack_profile`. These temp

> metadata are removed before sending the profile to UMA.

>

> Design Doc:

> https://docs.google.com/document/d/1PyOfAy2FhJi6xwXXWS6dTWk6g94gGU_EQkZB5gdGtBo/edit?usp=sharing&resourcekey=0-KnlMlMpiuO9zLlrCNx3IJA

entry.title: bindings: Put cooperative scheduling safepoint behind gn flag
entry.content:
This disables the general cooperative scheduling safepoint from

auto-generated bindings code. The feature is not launched with an

unclear timeline, so there's no need to pay the price in bindings for

reading TLS state on each call.



The safepoint can be enabled via gn arg

enable_blink_bindings_cooperating_scheduling = true



This shows up in setBindGroup() which is important for WebGPU but also

more generally in all workloads to a minor extent.



Change-Id: Iae656382a68b406c38626d26552fdb7927038828

Bug: 328470595

entry.title: Add user counters for RGB, OkLabOkLch, and out-of-Rec2020
entry.content:
Add counters for the CSS Color Level 4 syntax, dividing the syntax

into the classes of RGB spaces versus OkLab/OkLch (OkLxx). For these

two classes, track how often they specify a color outside of the

Rec2020 gamut.



This is to inform choices about how to handle out-of-range values

in the OkLab/OkLch syntax.



Mark the counters kCSSColorColorSpecifiedSpace, kCSSColorLabOklab,

and kCSSColorLchOklch obsolete, because they were observed not to be

used anymore.



Previously landed in crrev.com/1256189

Reverted in crrev.com/1256383

Reason for revert fixed in crrev.com/1256784

entry.title: [UNOp2][Android] Allow showing accounts list when sign-in flow starts
entry.content:
When the user selects "Choose Account" from sign-in promo (e.g. in the

bookmark manager"), the new sign-in flow should start and show the

expanded sign-in bottom sheet with an accounts list, instead of the

collapsed one.



A new sign-in bottom sheet mode has been introduced in

https://crrev.com/c/5319169. This CL uses it in the new sign-in flow

(eg. SigninAndHistoryOptInActivityLauncher) to allow sign-in entry

points to select the correct bottom sheet mode according to the user's

action. It also updates and adds tests accordingly.

entry.title: Revert "Reland "[ios] Improve build/toolchain/ios/swiftc.py script""
entry.content:
This reverts commit e628fca793dea9493483753d202c5ca54a52cb9d.



Reason for revert: The bots are still complaining.



Original change's description:

> Reland "[ios] Improve build/toolchain/ios/swiftc.py script"

>

> This is a reland of commit 555b7f43f59a6291b935c1dd8e99fc6ce77d183e

>

> Fixes the following issues that lead to reverting the original CL:

>

> 1. The compilation was sometimes considered dirty after an incremental

> build due to optimizations in both the script (FileWriter) and in

> swiftc itself where output file are not overwritten if identical.

>

> This was fixed by removing the use of FileWriter from the script and

> by touching all the outputs of the compilation (thus the file should

> now have newer timestamp than the source).

>

> 2. The compilation for catalyst environment was broken because swiftc

> expects different command-line argument for that environment (i.e.

> -isystem is unsupported, -Xcc ... is also unsupported).

>

> The script is modified to check whether the target triple

> corresponds to the catalyst environment (i.e. matches *-macabi)

> and constructs an acceptable command-line.

>

> 3. As `gn check ...` did not know about the Objective-C generated

> header for Swift modules, some dependencies were missing which

> also caused dirty build after an incremental build. This was

> fixed by https://crrev.com/c/5348787.

>

> Original change's description:

> > [ios] Improve build/toolchain/ios/swiftc.py script

> >

> > Change the script build/toolchain/ios/swiftc.py to configure the

> > swift compiler to generate $input.swiftconstvalues files (needed

> > for Intents API in swift).

> >

> > Improve the code to put all the derived data in one directory,

> > which allow removing the need for -pch-output-dir $dir from the

> > invocation of the script and its list of outputs (should avoid

> > the compilation error where $dir is created as a file instead of

> > a directory).

> >

> > Change toolchain.gni to pass all the tool versions as environment

> > variables instead of command-line arguments (reduce the length of

> > the command-line and remove the need to parse those arguments in

> > the script).

> >

> > Allow keeping the derived data dir between invocations of the

> > script (which may improve the build performance as the swiftc

> > binary will not have to rebuild the module cache each time).

> >

> > Bug: 326059372

> > Change-Id: I5e42676eb917fe2d355383aaa39a60d5674816fb

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5319176

> > Commit-Queue: Sylvain Defresne

> > Reviewed-by: Federica Germinario

> > Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1268444}

>

> Bug: 326059372

entry.title: Use term as the ARIA and internal role for the dt element
entry.content:
The ARIA role is specified here:

https://www.w3.org/TR/html-aam-1.0/#el-dt



That spec defers to the core-aam spec, which indicates platform

mappings:

https://www.w3.org/TR/core-aam-1.2/#role-map-term



In particular, it says term maps to IA2_ROLE_TEXT_FRAME under MSAA + IAccessible2.



There are also some changes to induce CollectionItemInfos for some

terms, which is I think due to the changes in browser_accessibility_android.cc



Otherwise, the mappings for kDescriptionListTerm and kTerm appear to

be the same.

entry.title: [iOS] Hide account picker early for Save to Photos
entry.content:
This CL makes SaveToPhotosMediator hide the account picker as soon as an

account has been selected by the user, rather than later when the upload

has fully completed. It also ensures interaction with the Manage Storage

alert is properly reflected in the Save to Photos UI outcome histogram.

entry.title: v4l2/stateless: Clear pending requests on destruction
entry.content:
Under normal conditions the decoder will receive an

EOS when playback is done. This will flush the pending

requests and wait for them to complete.



This flow doesn't have to occur. As shown with the

VideoDecoderTest.Decode test the caller can exit

without waiting for in flight requests to finish.



Bug: b:278935312

entry.title: Include Chrome DevTools Protocol logs in stderr for inspector-protocol tests
entry.content:
This CL adds logging of Chrome DevTools Protocol messages as processed

by DevToolsProtocolTestBindings to stderr for debugging purposes. The

messages are prefixed with `Protocol message: ` to be able to

distinguish them from other messages. While for successful runs the CDP

log is not very important, there seems to be no easy way to ensure logs

are flushed before the test runner kills the content shell process.



Current results for a failure: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/mac-rel/1692853/test-results?q=ID%3Aninja%3A%2F%2F%3Ablink_web_tests%2Fhttp%2Ftests%2Finspector-protocol%2Fissues%2Fcss-appearance-non-standard-issue.js+V%3Abuilder%3Dmac-rel+V%3Aos%3DMac-13+V%3Atest_suite%3Dblink_web_tests



Results with this CL: https://luci-milo.appspot.com/ui/inv/task-chromium-swarm.appspot.com-6804da9cd53c9211/test-results?q=ExactID%3Aninja%3A%2F%2F%3Ablink_web_tests%2Fhttp%2Ftests%2Finspector-protocol%2Ftarget%2Fauto-attach-wait-for-debugger-2-sessions-worker.js+VHash%3A32f081785efe9631



Bug: chromium:327140253

Change-Id: I9fab22e7facd4be4fa4f51f2e59b17444833566c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5318502

entry.title: Create holdback of CC Metrics V1 Termination Path
entry.content:
We recently landed some fixes to V3 traces. Followed by removing the V1

path.



The V1 path did have some termination controls for the V3, and during

the update we moved the termination decision to be in line with V3

processing.



We'd like to validate if some regressions we have seen are actual

performance regressions. Or if some known older V1/V3 edge cases were

occurring at a high enough volume that fixing them shifted the data.



This restores portions removed over three patches:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5176869

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5212207

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5224910



Bug: 40200408

Change-Id: I739f10ac6654f251549f46c578c42ddeb15356ed

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5344873

Reviewed-by: Victor Miura

Commit-Queue: Jonathan Ross

entry.title: Change used value of transform-box: stroke-box with non-scaling-stroke
entry.content:
Implements the resolution from [1]:



"If the tranform-box (sic!) is stroke-box and the element has

non-scaling-stroke, then the used transform-box is fill-box."



Move "access type" canonicalization into a UsedTransformBox() helper on

ComputedStyle, and handle this new case there as well.



[1] https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/9640#issuecomment-1942894984



Fixed: 40947107

entry.title: iwa: Add support for Update Channels (= "Release Trains")
entry.content:
Corresponding Spec Update: github.com/WICG/isolated-web-apps/pull/33

Internal design doc: go/iwa-update-channels



The channel IWAs are subscribed to is currently hardcoded to "default",

but this can change in the future once channel selection is possible via

admin policy or UI.



As part of this, I also removed the error case for when an Update

Manifest does not contain any versions - I always felt like this was a

bit unnecessary and added complexity. Now that even an Update Manifest

with versions may not have a version for a certain channel, it felt like

this special case has become even more superfluous.



Bug: 40267691, 294481776, 325054970

Change-Id: If0d7f406a2e207d9442bebc677eb2d17d00ab4f1

entry.title: Reland "DanglingPtr: make unretained dangling ptr detector crash by default"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 77c600a3e2e682a53987d04eda9b096436f22423



Original change's description:

> DanglingPtr: make unretained dangling ptr detector crash by default

>

> Now that the previous behavior of tagging those bugs as security bugs

> has been reverted (cl/566709391), it was decided that we switch the

> behavior to crashing by default. That way, those bugs have no security

> impact anymore.

>

> Change-Id: I1fb0526e9f89ecc3c330b2cdeb2e33919d9eb7a8

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4875091

> Commit-Queue: Paul Semel

> Reviewed-by: Kentaro Hara

entry.title: [//gpu] Add ClientSharedImage::GetTextureTarget(BufferFormat)
entry.content:
This is a variant of GetTextureTarget() that will support conversion of

clients that use the following pattern:



texture_target =

NativeBufferNeedsPlatformSpecificTextureTarget(format) ?

GetPlatformSpecificTextureTarget() : GL_TEXTURE_2D;



In the fullness of time we will merge the different

CSI::GetTextureTarget(...) variants into a CSI::GetTextureTarget()

function that internalizes all the necessary logic.

entry.title: android: SurfaceControl same AHB with new fence
entry.content:
Allow calling SurfaceControl SetBuffer using the same buffer but new

fence.



Previously the assumption is there is a queue of buffers and a new fence

is fence is needed only when there is a new buffer. This no longer holds

with single buffered canvas in overlay which will keep using the same

buffer each frame, but potentially with a new fence. So allow this case.



DCHECK in SetReadFence for this single buffer case because each

SetReadFence call corresponds to a SetBuffer call, but there is no

guarantee on exact timing, and now there can be multiple SetBuffer call

using the same buffers. It's minimally useful so just remove it.

entry.title: Optimize internal string container of WatermarkView
entry.content:
WatermarkView doesn't need the strings it holds to be `std::strings`,

so changing that type to `SkTextBlob` instead will optimize the

implementation of the watermark painting by not continuously

reallocating new memory for blocks of text.

entry.title: [mullhet] Add "Manage password" button.
entry.content:
This CL adds "Manage password" button the the manage password

details view. The button is added only if the feature flag is on.

Previously, parent view added a margin to the bottom of this view.

Now, the margin should be 0 so that this view looks the same as

the manage passwords view and its "Manage passwords" button.



The functionality of opening the password settings page will be

implemented in the subsequent CLs.



Please note that "Manage password" and "Manage passwords" are

different buttons: the newly added button should navigate to

the settings page where the user can edit a specific password.

The existing "Manage passwords" button navigates just to the

password manager page.



Please note that the icons are not aligned properly right now, because

RichHoverButton spacing parameters are not the same as those used to

create username and password rows. This alignment will be done in a

separate CL.



Mocks: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/7PFuGmewmVZ3QJP.png

Implementation: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/8D5TZggFyKFYv4B.png



Bug: b/326230114

entry.title: [UNOp2][Android] Add option to open the expanded sign-in bottom sheet
entry.content:
When the user selects "Choose Account" from sign-in promo (e.g. in the

bookmark manager"), the new sign-in flow should start and show the

expanded sign-in bottom sheet with an accounts list, instead of the

collapsed one.



As a first step, this CL updates the sign-in account picker bottom

sheet, by creating the AccountPickerLaunchMode enum, and use it in the

coordinator constructor, to allow the embedder to choose which view

should be shown when the bottom sheet appears.



It also adds a few tests for the newly introduced launch mode. The

AccountPickerBottomSheetTest test suite is updated with new tests

in a separated CL (https://crrev.com/c/5345254) since flakiness fix

for existing test was necessary.



Bug: 41493769, 41493768

entry.title: [UPMLocalPwd] Add metrics for local passwords migration
entry.content:
The CL introduces 3 count histograms:

- PasswordManager.UnifiedPasswordManager.MigrationForLocalUsers.

AddedToAndroidBackend - number of credentials added to GmsCore during

migration.

- PasswordManager.UnifiedPasswordManager.MigrationForLocalUsers.

UpdatedInAndroidBackend - number of credentials, which already existed

in GmsCore but were updated during migration.

- PasswordManager.UnifiedPasswordManager.MigrationForLocalUsers.

MidratedToAndroidBackendTotal - number of credentials added or updated

in GmsCore during migraion.



The metric is written after the migration is done for all credentials

that were successfully migrated.

entry.title: Fix bad variant access in CookieSettings
entry.content:
Before the CL: On construction, CookiesSettings checks the flag

kHostIndexedMetadataGrants to decide whether content_settings_ will be

of type EntryIndex or EntryMap. On every access of content_settings_,

the flag is checked again to decide the type to pass to absl::get<>.



Problem: In some tests, it seems the class is constructed with the flag

enabled but destroyed with the flag disabled, causing content_settings_

to be accessed with the wrong type. Given the presence of

CreateDeleteCookieOnExitPredicate() in the stack trace, I speculate

the flag overrides of fieldtrial_testing_config.json are gone by the

time of destruction.



After the CL: Check the flag once, on construction. From then on,

check absl::holds_alternative<>. This could potentially uncover

other problems but at least fixes android_sync_integration_tests for

me locally.



Fixed: 328252586

Change-Id: Ibd195c5ddbad347a8fdd0a44d1596de6ddf31119

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5349459

entry.title: Reland "[WebView][WebAuthn] Introduce WebSettings.setWebAuthnSupport"
entry.content:
With the reland of crrev.com/c/5327926, this should be reland to safe.

No changes wrt the original CL.



This is a reland of commit 991e4f9f43589d8451c10475ba39f4054076d560



Original change's description:

> [WebView][WebAuthn] Introduce WebSettings.setWebAuthnSupport

>

> The support is per WebView. Hence, we cache the support per WebContents.

> When the WebContents of a WebView change, we update the cache.

>

> Test method:

> 1 - androidx does not have the API yet. Thus, I modified the

> WebSettingsCompat.setAlgorithmicDarkeningAllowed to call the new

> setWebAuthnSupport API. Then I used the API in the test app.

> 2 - Used the custom GMSCore which includes the ResultReceiver changes.

>

> Demo: https://photos.app.goo.gl/bsrJtCuAMM2Ee9Je8

> In the demo you see two WebViews within a single app. The first has

> WebAuthn disabled; the second is in app mode.

>

entry.title: Revert "Skip static animations on compositor and main"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 3690cd7872423e81e74dc66f9886e355a7c1b659.



Reason for revert: virtual/threaded-no-composited-antialiasing/animations

tests started failing on multiple builders after this CL.

* https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-bfcache-rel

* https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/mac11-arm64-rel-tests

* https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/mac12-arm64-rel-tests

* https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20Tests



Original change's description:

> Skip static animations on compositor and main

>

> An animation with empty keyframes or with keyframes whose property

> values are identical between frames previously ran as a normal

> animation. As there is no visual change other than at a phase boundary,

> these animations do not need to run on the compositor, and only need

> to be scheduled on the main thread at phase boundaries.

>

> This is the first step in optimizing no-op animations. A follow up

> patch will short-circuit sampling when the property value is constant.

> Another patch will refine the rules for background color compositing

> to only consider dynamic properties. Finally, metrics will be added

> to track shorthand expansion of CSS properties, which is likely the

> most common source of static properties in CSS animations.

>

> Bug: 40728212

> Change-Id: I1baff2d0d26400f91f12d4cac2141e9bb101b3d0

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5328026

> Reviewed-by: Ian Clelland

> Reviewed-by: Robert Flack

> Commit-Queue: Kevin Ellis

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1268998}



Bug: 40728212

Change-Id: Idccfa689d7a3b6e6ee9e2b6a5d109c94a4d3870b
